Title: We must redesign Nigeria’s political map in 2027, Okorie tells Igbo
Summary: We must redesign Nigeria’s political map in 2027, Okorie tells Igbo . Chief (Dr) Chekwas Okorie declared that the Igbo nation must deploy.

Title: Governor Yusuf presents N1.36tr 2026 budget
Summary: Kano Governor, Abba Kabir Yusuf, has presented the 2026 Appropriation Bill totalling N1,368,127,929,271 to the State House of Assembly . Governor Yusuf presents N1.36tr 2026 budget .

Title: IEI announces leadership transition
Summary: International Energy Insurance Plc announces leadership transition . Olasupo Sogelola has stepped down from his role as Managing Director/Chief Executive Officer .

Title: HID Awolowo Foundation to host national dialogue on women in politics
Summary: HID Awolowo Foundation to host national dialogue on women in politics . As Nigeria joins global community in marking three decades since Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action .

Title: Demolitions at Trade Fair: Between enforcement and economic waste
Summary: The demolition of multi-billion-naira shops at the Trade Fair Complex and 19 other buildings in Lagos has again raised posers .

Title: How conducive environment leads to better learning outcomes — World Bank report
Summary: World Bank report shows how inadequate learning environment can undermine promise of education . Well-designed spaces can enhance teaching methods and lead to better student outcomes . Education is the pathway to jobs and the surest way out of poverty, empowering generations .

Title: Detty December 2025: Ciara’s Lagos visit sets tone
Summary: Echoes of Ciara’s visit continue to reverberate as she reunited with veteran supermodel Naomi Campbell at a fashion event in France .

Title: Fear grips Labour as ban on alcoholic beverages, others threatens million jobs
Summary: Food and beverage sector workers are gripped by fear as the . consequences of the ban will be “far-reaching, devastating and irreversible” Labour says . The ban on alcoholic beverages, others threatens million jobs .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, November 20, 2025
Summary: The naira traded at roughly ₦1,451 to the US dollar in the official Nigerian Foreign Exchange Market (NFEM) on November 20, 2025 . The parallel (black) market quoted the dollar around � 1,475 .

Title: Nigeria wasting millions of jobs — Report
Summary: Nigeria may be forfeiting millions of potential jobs by failing to prioritise agriculture, a new data-driven report says . Nigeria is forfeiting millions of potential potential jobs, according to the report .

Title: Army chief visits Borno, charges troops to sustain vigilance
Summary: The Chief of Army Staff, Lieutenant General Waidi Shaibu, has asked troops of Operation HADIN KAI to remain alert and maintain an aggressive posture in ongoing operations against terrorists in the North-East . Title: Govt eyes N1.49tn electricity export revenue
Summary: The Federal Government is projecting nearly $1bn in annual revenue from electricity exports to 15 West African countries under the Economic Community of West African States sub-region from June 2026 . Title: ISWAP leader jailed 20 years, Ansaru terrorists’ trial begins January
Summary: Hussaini Ismaila, a leader of the Islamic State West Africa Province, has been sentenced to 20 years in prison for terrorism-related offences . The sentence takes effect from the date of his arrest, August 31, 2017 . The trial of two alleged Ansaru leaders, Mahmud Usman and Abubakar Abba,

Title: B’Haram: Zulum meets COAS, says ‘the worst’ is over
Summary: Borno State Governor Babagana Zulum declared that the security situation in the state has significantly improved . Zulum made the remark during a meeting with the Chief of Army Staff, Lt. Gen. Shuaibu Waidi, in Maiduguri . The governor urged residents to remain vigilant and continue providing intelligence to security agencies .

Title: Banditry: Kwara closes schools in  four LGs, demands military base
Summary: Kwara State Government orders closure of schools across four Local government areas . The decision was disclosed by the Nigeria Union of Teachers . The NUT Chairman, Yusuf Agboola, announced the shutdown of schools in Isin, Irepodun, Ifelodun and Ekiti LGAs .
